      • MySystem

        private MySystem()
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
        This is the constructor method
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - in case the districts file could not be found. This should be placed in the project folder and named "District_names.txt"
        java.io.IOException - in case there is an error reading the file

      • logIn

        public boolean logIn​(java.lang.String nickname,
                     java.lang.String password)
        This method returns true or false depending on the user's nickname, password and private status
        Parameters:
        nickname - of the user who wants to log in
        password - of the user who wants to log in
        Returns:
        true if there is a user with the given nickname, the password was correct and its private status is "accepted"; or false otherwise

      • logInAdmin

        public boolean logInAdmin​(java.lang.String nickname,
                          java.lang.String password)
        This method returns true or false depending on the administrator's nickname and password
        Parameters:
        nickname - of the administrator
        password - of the administrator
        Returns:
        true if the nickname and password of the administrator are correct, false otherwise

      • logUp

        public boolean logUp​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String iD,
                     java.lang.String passwd)
        This method returns true or false depending on the length of the ID and the nickname
        Parameters:
        name - , nickname of the new user
        iD - , the user ID
        passwd - , the password of the new user
        Returns:
        false if the ID does not have 9 character or the name is already user, true otherwise

      • read

        public void read()
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                 java.io.IOException
        This method calls the serialization class to load all the saved data of the application
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file to work with is not found
        java.io.IOException - in case there is an error reading, writing the file

           throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,

        This method calls the serialization class to write all the data of the application

        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file to work with is not found
